meanings.definition: To record (something) in advance on tape.
meanings.sent1: She pretapes her favorite TV shows to watch later.
meanings.sent2: He always pretapes his lectures to ensure they are clear and concise.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel pretapes its acorn hiding spots for the winter.
meanings.sent4: The athlete pretapes his ankles before every game to prevent injuries.
meanings.sent5: Before the storm, the meteorologist pretapes the weather forecast for safety measures.

meanings.definition: A recording made in advance on tape.
meanings.sent1: The radio station has a collection of pretapes for emergencies.
meanings.sent2: She found an old pretape of her favorite band's concert.
meanings.sent3: The pretape of the baby's first words brought tears to the parents' eyes.
meanings.sent4: The pretape of the interview captured the essence of the artist's personality.
meanings.sent5: The pretape of the nature sounds helped him relax during meditation.
